Title: Copeland Launches Sensi Hydro Sanitary Water Heat Pump in Southeast Asia
Summary: (Oct. 9, 2025) – Copeland, a global provider of sustainable climate solutions, has launched its Sensi Hydro sanitary water heat pump in southeast Asia. This integrated heating solution is designed to provide energy-efficient water heating tailored for hotels, commercial buildings and public facilities. The launch underscores Copeland’s commitment to advancing the energy transition to electrified heating technology, helping to reduce global emissions and achieving decarbonization goals.

Title: Panasonic Strengthens Refrigeration Leadership with Launch of iCORE CO₂ Range Across Europe
Summary: Panasonic Heating & Cooling Solutions has announced the European availability of its iCORE range of CO₂ condensing units, underscoring its position as a global leader in commercial refrigeration solutions and meeting the evolving needs of operators across Europe.

Title: Harron Homes Meets New Future Home Standard with Sustainable Panasonic Aquarea Heat Pumps
Summary: Housing developer, Harron Homes, was looking to adopt renewable heating into its new build housing project at the Nevison’s Fold development in Barnsley, South Yorkshire. The project included a collaborative stakeholder effort from Harron Homes in conjunction with specialists, Secon Renewables, Panasonic, UK Cylinders, Honeywell Home and installers D&R Plumbing & Heating and Steve Wade Electrical, which included utilising the Panasonic Aquarea J Series Monobloc Air-to-Water heat pump.

Title: Mitsubishi Electric: WZ-E for Data Centers
Summary: In data centers, temperature and air quality are strategic in ensuring business continuity for digital infrastructures. In addition to ensuring the removal of heat generated by servers and the maintenance of stable thermo-hygrometric conditions, an advanced IT Cooling system must in fact also ensure the protection of equipment from dust, humidity, and contaminants.

Title: Md Mehrab Hossen Siam Receives Graduate Endowed Fellowship
Summary: Congratulations to Center for Environmental Energy Engineering (CEEE) graduate research assistant Md Mehrab Hossen Siam on receiving the Dr. Reinhard Radermacher Distinguished Graduate Endowed Fellowship for Energy Innovation in Mechanical Engineering for 2025-26. The fellowship is awarded annually and supports one CEEE graduate student for an academic year.

Title: Lam Research Receives 2025 SEMI Award for North America
Summary: — October 7, 2025 — SEMI, the industry association serving the global semiconductor and electronics design and manufacturing supply chain, today announced Lam Research Corp. as the recipient of the 2025 SEMI Award for North America. Lam earned the recognition for its cryogenic etch technology, a breakthrough innovation that advances 3D NAND device manufacturing essential for today’s data-intensive AI applications. SEMI Americas presented the award to Lam during SEMICON® West, the premier microelectronics exhibition taking place in Phoenix, Arizona this week.

Title: Hubbard: the new era of ice machines is here!
Summary: At Host Milano 2025, the company unveils 4 ground breaking products that combine innovation, efficiency, and design to meet the evolving needs of the hospitality industry.

Title: Vulcan Announces Third Quarter 2025 Conference Call
Summary: ., Oct. 9, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Vulcan Materials Company (NYSE: VMC) will host its third quarter 2025 earnings conference call on Thursday, October 30, 2025 at 9:00 a.m. CT (10:00 a.m. ET). Financial results will be released before the NYSE market opens.

Title: Carrier Board of Directors Declares Quarterly Cash Dividend
Summary: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla., Oct. 8, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Carrier Global Corporation (NYSE: CARR), global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions, announced today that its Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend of $0.225 per outstanding share of Carrier common stock. The dividend will be payable on November 18, 2025 to shareowners of record at the close of business on October 29, 2025.

Title: Weil-Mclain: Hybrid Hydronic Heat + DHW for Residential Homes
Summary: When a homeowner in the Chicagoland area wanted to improve energy efficiency and lower propane heating costs, contractor James Downs of JMD Associates recommended an innovative solution: the ECO™ Hybrid Dual Fuel Hydronic System from Weil-McLain. Installed in a 20-year-old home near Lake Michigan, the system combines an air-to-water heat pump with a high efficiency gas boiler to deliver optimal performance and flexibility across a wide range of temperatures.

Title: Primetals Technologies Successfully Completes DC Drives Upgrade for Sterling Steel
Summary: Primetals Technologies has recently successfully completed a significant modernization project for Sterling Steel Company, LLC, located in Sterling, Illinois, the US. The project involved upgrading 16 DC drives for the company’s rolling mill stands and was officially concluded with the receipt of the final acceptance certificate (FAC).

Title: What does EHPA actually do?
Summary: So we thought we’d pull back the curtain and give examples of some of the things the European Heat Pump Association has done so far this year. Are you ready?!

Title: LU-VE: Financial highlights results as of September 30, 2025
Summary: ·  The order book as of September 30, 2025, stands at € 238.6 million, marking a +37% increase compared December 2024 and +38.7% compared to September 2024.

Title: Diesel engine manufacturer saves €165 000 annually by installing a Heat Pump
Summary: The customer operates a compressor room with five units, totaling 7 000 running hours per year. With the long-term objective of achieving carbon neutrality by 2050, they contacted Atlas Copco.

Title: EHPA feedback on the revision the General Block Exemption Regulation (GBER)
Summary: The European Heat Pump Association (EHPA) welcomes the European Commission’s initiative to simplify and update the State aid rules, particularly with respect to the General Block Exemption Regulation (hereinafter referred to as GBER). This revision represents a valuable opportunity to make full use of state aid instruments to direct national subsidies toward priority industries.

Title: Johnson Controls announces fourth quarter 2025 earnings conference call webcast
Summary: , Oct. 8, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Johnson Controls International plc (NYSE: JCI), the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings, announces the following webcast:

Title: Mitsubishi Electric Hybrid Cooling Solutions
Summary: In hyperscale data centers, where thermal loads are extremely high and energy efficiency is a top priority, Mitsubishi Electric offers advanced hybrid cooling solutions that combine liquid and air cooling technologies.

Title: Cold Chain Federation welcome new member Premier Sealant Systems Ltd
Summary: Sealprem are UK manufacturers of specialist sealing solutions for coldstore construction and temperature-controlled environments. With over 30 years of expertise, we help contractors and operators achieve airtightness, reduce energy loss and ensure long-term durability in demanding chilled and frozen applications. Our in-house team are on hand to deliver solutions quickly, backed by ISO-certified quality and a commitment to sustainability.

Title: Thermo King Extends Compatibility with B100 Biofuel to Support Sustainable Refrigerated Transport
Summary: Thermo King’s diesel truck refrigeration unit are now certified with more sustainable fuel options, ensuring no impact on maintenance or warranty coverage.

Title: Danfoss celebrates the 25th anniversary of the SVL Valve portfolio
Summary: The SVL portfolio has met the changing requirements for industrial refrigeration – from the shift to natural refrigerants, to demands for greater energy efficiency and higher pressures and temperatures. Join our product manager as we reflect on 25 years of technological advancements that have kept the SVL portfolio relevant for customers worldwide.

Title: Swegon: Beyond energy efficiency, the revised EPBD puts IEQ in focus
Summary: The latest revision of the Energy Performance of Buildings Directive (EPBD) is more than just a regulatory update, it signals a structural shift in how Europe approaches sustainability in the built environment. Our expert, Mikael Börjesson, Future Solutions & Public Affairs Director at Swegon, explains how the directive’s extended scope elevates indoor environmental quality (IEQ) and emphasises how energy efficiency can no longer compromise a good indoor climate for the people inside.

Title: FreshFlow Food Solutions Celebrates First Audit Success with ‘A’ Accreditation
Summary: Vegetable processing specialist FreshFlow Food Solutions, part of the Oakland International group, is celebrating a major milestone after its new Midlands facility secured a coveted BRCGS ‘A’ accreditation at its very first audit.

Title: Trane Technologies Declares Quarterly Dividend
Summary: --(BUSINESS WIRE)-- The Board of Directors of Trane Technologies plc (NYSE:TT), a global climate innovator, declared a quarterly dividend of $0.94 per ordinary share, or $3.76 per share annualized. The dividend is payable December 31, 2025, to shareholders of record on December 5, 2025.

Title: Carrier Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Advisory
Summary: , Oct. 7, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Carrier Global Corporation (NYSE: CARR), global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions, will release its third quarter 2025 earnings on Tuesday, October 28, 2025 and host a conference call and webcast at 7:30 a.m. ET.

Title: Bosch puts its first hydrogen truck into service in plant traffic
Summary: Nuremberg, Germany – Bosch has taken a further step on the road to climate-friendly logistics – with one of the technology company’s own products. Its Nuremberg plant recently started using a fuel-cell electric truck in plant traffic. The truck is equipped with the Bosch fuel-cell power module (FCPM), which was recently nominated for the prestigious German President’s Future Prize. “When we decided to make our plant traffic more climate-friendly, it was clear that we wanted a truck featuring Bosch’s FCPM,” explains Alexander Weichsel, the commercial plant manager in Nuremberg. “This deployment is an important building block that helps us reduce our emissions in logistics. The fact that several thousand trucks with Bosch fuel-cell systems are already on the road worldwide shows that the concept is proving its worth.” By converting hydrogen and oxygen into water and electricity, the 40-ton truck can be operated completely electrically. Using renewable hydrogen even makes the truck’s powertrain climate neutral. By switching to the new vehicle, Bosch also wants to set an example in Nuremberg and play an active role in developing a hydrogen value chain in line with the state of Bavaria’s Hydrogen Strategy 2.0.

Title: Faster, a Helios Technologies Operating Company, Launches the New MultiFaster; Built to Complement, Engineered for More Pressure
Summary: --(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Helios Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: HLIO) (“Helios” or the “Company”), a global leader in highly engineered motion control and electronic controls technology, announces its operating company Faster S.r.l. has introduced the New MultiFaster, the next generation of its most renowned trademark product. Building on the legacy of the original MultiFaster, the latest evolution combines proven technology with enhanced performance, durability, and operator convenience to meet the growing demands of new end markets.

Title: BCIA: the BEMS sector’s biggest event in 2026!
Summary: Excitement for the Building Controls Industry Association (BCIA) Awards 2026 is ramping up, with entries for the eleven award categories open on 8th October for all budding individuals and organisations keen to take part.

Title: Opportunities to Use Energy Efficiency and Demand Flexibility to Reduce Data Center Energy Use and Peak Demand
Summary: ·  Data centers are often the largest source of load growth for utilities, according to projections through 2030, and they are contributing to rising electricity costs. Data centers accounted for about 4% of U.S. electricity sales in 2023 (latest available), with projections ranging from 6.7–12.0% in 2028. Up to 70% of the projected growth in data center loads is expected to be hyperscale (deploying services at massive scale, including AI).

Title: Data Center Efficiency and Load Flexibility Can Reduce Power Grid Strain and Costs
Summary: Driven by AI, data centers are multiplying, with daunting forecasts for electricity use ahead. A new wave of efficiency improvement is needed to accompany this growth in computing.

Title: CEEE Faculty Honored With Top University Awards
Summary: Two CEEE faculty members received top honors at the 2025-26 University of Maryland Faculty & Staff Convocation held in September at the university's Memorial Chapel.
